children.subject: any idea what is top30% students' GPA? Will I get an invitation email or something?

<md>I'm not sure as it's not public information, but I think it's been stated to be ~3.8 though possibly higher now with PNP. You should get an invitation email around the first couple weeks of the semester if you're above the cutoff</md>
<md>@anon scale they notify you via email</md>

We will notify you via email by this week (latest early next week). GPA cutoff is not public information and we receive them directly from the CS dept too, though it seems to be anywhere between 3.8 - 3.9.
Are students that have completed all the declaration requirements but not had their declaration officially processed by the department eligible?
<md>UPE is the HKN for CS majors and you need to be a declared CS major with an overall gpa in the top 30% of declared students</md>

history.content:
HKN, TBP, and UPE are all different honor societies, each with a GPA percentile-based intake

HKN is EECS majors since it is primarily Electrical and Computer Engineering

The College of Engineering extends an invitation every semester to students in the top third of the senior class or the top quarter of the junior class (determined by class standing) of EECS majors here at UC Berkeley. Class standing is based on units, not length of stay at Berkeley, which includes your AP credits + Community College.

TBP is all College of Engineering majors + Berkeley's Chemical Engineering under College of Chemistry

(IEOR falls under this category)

Eligibility is extended every semester to students in the top fifth of the senior class or the top eighth of the junior class (determined by standing) of Engineering students here at UC Berkeley. Class standing is based on units, not length of stay at Berkeley, which includes your AP credits + Community College.

UPE is for Computer Science only (I think)

According to Beom Jin (Brian) Lee in the Followups, this isn't public

I couldn't find APM with a Google Search

- From a HKN and TBP member

TBP is all College of Engineering majors + Berkeley's Chemical Engineering under College of Chemistry

(IEOR falls under this category)

Eligibility is extended every semester to students in the top fifth of the senior class or the top eighth of the junior class (determined by standing) of Engineering students here at UC Berkeley

UPE is for Computer Science only (I think)

According to Beom Jin (Brian) Lee in the Followups, this isn't public

I couldn't find APM with a Google Search

- From a HKN and TBP member

Is HKN only open to EECS major, not CS? 

What about APM, just for IEOR, not ORMS?

how do I join a honor society, in general?
